alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:07PM EST until January 10 at 10:36PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... South Branch Raritan River At Stanton affecting Hunterdon and Somerset Counties. For the Raritan River...including Stanton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Raritan River at Stanton. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding downstream of gauge. At 8.0 feet, Right bank and approach to bridge is flooded. At 10.0 feet, Houses downstream begin to take on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 3.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 9.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 12/28/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date South Branch Rar Stanton 8.0 3.0 Tue 4 pm 7.6 5.1 9.8 7am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EST.
